title: Robert Wilkie
added: Wilkie said Confederate President [[Jefferson Davis]] was a "martyr to 'The [[Lost Cause of the Confederacy|Lost Cause]]'" and an "exceptional man in an exceptional age" in a 1995 speech at the US Capitol. Wilkie also spoke about [[Robert E. Lee]] to the [[Sons of Confederate Veterans]] (SCV) at a pro-Confederate event in 2009. He also called [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionists]] who opposed slavery "radical", "mendacious", and "enemies of liberty", and stated that the Confederate "cause was honorable,"<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/07/politics/va-secretary-confederate-president/index.html|title=VA secretary praised Confederate president as a "martyr to 'The Lost Cause'" in 1995 speech|last=Kaczynski|first=Andrew|date=December 7, 2018|work=CNN|access-date=December 7, 2018}}</ref> while also condemning [[slavery in the United States|slavery]] as "a stain on our story as it is a stain on every civilization in history".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.stltoday.com/news/national/trump-s-va-secretary-is-a-fan-of-jefferson-davis/article_e76c2af4-0e98-5fbc-ad17-2964fd35e827.html|title=Trump's VA secretary is a fan of Jefferson Davis. But Davis was loathed in the Confederacy.|last=Selk|first=Avi|date=December 10, 2018|work=St. Louis Post Dispatch|access-date=December 18, 2018}}</ref> Wilkie is a former member of the [[Sons of Confederate Veterans|SCV]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Itkowitz |first1=Colby |title=The Health 202: 'We will hold you accountable.' Democrats grill Azar on family separations |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-health-202/2018/06/27/the-health-202-we-will-hold-you-accountable-democrats-grill-azar-on-family-separations/5b323ecd1b326b3967989c7a/ |accessdate=9 December 2018 |work=Washington Post |date=June 27, 2018}}</ref>

During Wilkie's confirmation hearings, he gave inaccurate answers to Senators in claiming that he had not spoken to Confederate groups in a much longer time than he really had.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/14/politics/kfile-robert-wilkie-senate-testimony-confirmation/index.html?no-st=1544917747|title=VA secretary gave inaccurate answers on pro-Confederate ties during confirmation process|last=Kaczynski|first=Andrew|date=December 14, 2018|work=CNN|access-date=December 14, 2018}}</ref> In sworn statements to the Senate as part of the nomination questionnaire, he failed to include his membership in the Confederate Memorial Committee and omitted his event speeches from responses asking for details on them.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/01/04/politics/kfile-wilkie-confirmation-form/index.html|title=VA Secretary Robert Wilkie didn't disclose pro-Confederate associations on confirmation paperwork|last=Kaczynski|first=Andrew|date=January 4, 2019|work=CNN|access-date=}}</ref>
